text:
This is really trivial, but just to keep some entries in sync, these tasks are in the optional tasks group and should be moved up to the core tasks group.

Apt
MakeURL
EchoXML
ResourceCount
creator: robert.flaherty@oracle.com
mbenson@apache.org
text: What leads you to believe these tasks are in the optional tasks group?  The implementing Java classes are all in package org.apache.tools.ant.taskdefs, and the manual pages are all under the Core Tasks group.  Color me confused.

creator: robert.flaherty@oracle.com
text:
In default.properties:


# standard ant tasks
...

# optional tasks
...
apt=org.apache.tools.ant.taskdefs.Apt
echoxml=org.apache.tools.ant.taskdefs.EchoXML
makeurl=org.apache.tools.ant.taskdefs.MakeUrl
resourcecount=org.apache.tools.ant.taskdefs.ResourceCount


I was referring to moving those entries up.  Again I know its' picky, I was just in there looking up the impl class for a task, and noticed them.
